title: Senior Manager, Workday Specialist
content:
Job Description:
We are seeking an accomplished and hands-on Senior Workday Solutions/Specialist to join our HRIS team. In this role, you will be instrumental in leading the design, implementation, and enhancement of Workday solutions within our organization. We're looking for a seasoned professional with a robust technical background, extensive consulting expertise, multiple Workday certifications, and a proven history of crafting and executing successful Workday solutions. Reporting to the Associate Director, HRIS, you will provide strategic guidance, lead a team of consultants, and collaborate with stakeholders to align Workday solutions with our evolving business objectives.
 
Responsibilities:
Workday Solution Design and Strategy:

Collaborate closely with HR stakeholders, business leaders, and technical teams to define requirements and devise scalable Workday solutions aligned with strategic business goals.
Utilize your hands-on expertise to configure and customize diverse Workday modules, including  Security, Payroll, Compensation, Benefits, Talent Management, Time Tracking, and Absence Management.
Lead the creation of intricate Workday integrations, ensuring seamless data flow and optimal system interoperability.

 
Leadership and Project Management:

Take the lead on Workday implementation projects, overseeing their successful execution within designated scope, timeline, and budget parameters.
Effectively manage project resources, including a team of consultants and developers, ensuring their work yields high-quality deliverables.
Define project milestones, tasks, and dependencies, while delivering regular status updates to stakeholders.
Navigate potential risks and proactively resolve issues throughout the project lifecycle.

 
Consulting and Stakeholder Engagement:

Serve as a trusted advisor to stakeholders, offering expert guidance on Workday best practices, solution design, and industry trends.
Conduct workshops and facilitate discussions to gather comprehensive requirements, define optimized business processes, and propose effective Workday solutions.
Foster collaboration across cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate Workday with other HR systems and third-party applications.

 
System Optimization and Continuous Enhancement:

Stay on top of the latest Workday updates, features, and enhancements, evaluating their potential impact on the organization's Workday environment.
Identify opportunities to enhance existing Workday configurations, integrations, and processes to improve system performance and user experience.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives by evaluating HR processes, identifying automation possibilities, and implementing innovative Workday solutions.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Relevant work experience will also be considered.
Minimum of 5 years' experience in roles such as Workday Solutions Architect or similar, focusing on solution design, implementation, and optimization.
Hands-on experience in configuring and customizing diverse Workday modules, including HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Talent Management, Time Tracking, and Absence Management.
Multiple Workday certifications in modules such as HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Talent Management, or Financials.
In-depth understanding of Workday's architecture, including business process framework, security, integration, and reporting.
Proven track record of leading and successfully delivering complex Workday implementation projects.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the capacity to analyze intricate requirements and devise innovative solutions.
Exceptional consulting skills, including the ability to translate business requirements into technical designs effectively.
Proficiency in Workday Studio, EIBs, calculated fields, and/or report writing.
Familiarity with Workday Prism Analytics is a bonus.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with stakeholders at all organizational levels.
Strong leadership and team management capabilities, coupled with a focus on nurturing and advancing team members.
Demonstrated project management skills, enabling you to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects concurrently.

 
By joining us as a Senior Workday Solutions/Specialist, you will be at the forefront of steering the success of our HRIS initiatives and driving innovation in our Workday solutions.
#LI-CX1About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
